subject: RE: [junit] written recommendation of super.setUp/tearDown ?
msgSnippet: David, This is true for new-style tests (old tests run exactly the way they always did). @Before methods are run superclass-first and @After methods are run
messageBody:
David,

This is true for new-style tests (old tests run exactly the way they always
did). @Before methods are run superclass-first and @After methods are run
subclass-first. Shadowed @Before and @After methods are not run. The
relevant tests are in AnnotationTest: testOrderingOfInheritance() and
testShadowing().

Sincerely yours,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of David Saff
> Sent: Wednesday, July 27, 2005 5:43 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] written recommendation of super.setUp/tearDown ?
>
> Allan,
>
> To the best of my knowledge, JUnit 4 will automatically ensure that
> setup and teardown methods from superclasses are called at the
> appropriate time.
>
> David Saff
